sen.j: 堺事件（さかいじけん）は、慶応4年（1868年）に和泉国堺市で起きた、フランス水兵殺害の責を負って土佐藩士が切腹した事件。
sen.e: The Sakai Incident refers to the case in which a retainers of the Tosa Domain committed seppuku (suicide by disembowelment) to accept the responsibility for the killing of French sailors in Sakai City, Izumi Province in 1868.

The Sakai Incident refers to the case in which a retainers of the Tosa Domain committed seppuku (suicide by disembowelment) to accept the responsibility for the killing of French sailors in Sakai City, Izumi Province in 1868.

sen.j: 泉州堺事件（せんしゅうさかいじけん）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called the Senshu Sakai Incident.

tit.cmt: 用語集にしたがって直しました。

sen.j: 攘夷論のいまだおさまらぬ慶応4年2月15日 (旧暦)（1868年3月8日）、フランス領事一行は大阪から陸路、堺に入ろうとした。
sen.e: On March 8, 1868, when people who supported the principle of excluding foreigners were still active, the party of the French consulate was entering Sakai from Osaka by land.
On March 8, 1868, when people who supported the principle of excluding foreigners were still active, the party of the French consulate was entering Sakai from Osaka by land.

sen.j: 外国事務局からその通報の無かった警備の土佐藩兵はこれを阻み、中途で引き返させた。
sen.e: The security officer of the Tosa Domain, who was not informed of the party from a foreign affairs office, blocked them and let them retreat.
The security officer of the Tosa Domain, who was not informed of the party from a foreign affairs office, blocked them and forced them to retreat.
The security officer of the Tosa Domain, who was not informed of the party from a foreign affairs office, blocked them and forced them to retreat.

sen.j: 同日夕刻、領事一行を迎えるべくフランス海軍のコルベット艦デュプレクス (コルベット)は堺港に入り、士官以下数十名の水兵が上陸、市内を徘徊した。
sen.e: In the evening, Dupleix, a corvette of the French Navy, arrived at the Sakai port to pick up the party, and several dozens of French sailors of under-officer ranks landed on the area to roam around the city.

In the evening, Dupleix, a corvette of the French Navy, arrived at the Sakai port to pick up the party, and several dozens of French sailors of under-officer ranks landed on the area to roam around the city.

sen.j: 土佐藩軍艦府は、警備の藩兵に取締を命じ、帰艦を諭示させたが、言葉が通じず、混雑もあって、水兵側は土佐の隊旗を倒伏、逃亡しようとした。
sen.e: Gunkan-fu (warship section) of the Tosa Domain ordered the Tosa security retainers to police the sailors and ask them to go back to the ship, but due to language barriers and a congestion of the area, the French sailors tried to escape from the security by knocking over a flag of the security group.

Gunkan-fu (warship section) of the Tosa Domain ordered the Tosa security retainers to police the sailors and urged them to go back to the ship, but due to language barriers and a congestion of the area, the French sailors tried to escape from the security by knocking over a flag of the security group.
sen.cmt: ask→urgedとしました。Due to以下(言葉、混雑)は逃亡の原因となっていないので、間接的な原因を示す言葉のほうが良いかもしれないと思われます。By knocking over･･･も、「旗を倒すことによって逃亡」したのではないので、byではない言葉のほうが良いかもしれないと思われます。
sen.e: The Gunkan-fu (warship section) of the Tosa Domain ordered Tosa security retainers to police the sailors and urge them to return to their ship; confused as a result of the language barrier and the congestion in the area, however, the French sailors tried to escape from the security retainers, knocking over a flag of the Tosa security group in the process.
sen.cmt: urged→urge(これも軍艦府の命令のうちだと思われるので）チェッカーのコメントに基づいて少し変更しました。

sen.j: このため、土佐藩側はこれを逮捕しようとして捕らえるのではなく、咄嗟に発砲し、フランス人11人を殺傷または、海に落として溺死させた。
sen.e: Therefore, the Tosa retainers fired a gun at once instead of arresting them, and killed, wounded or drowned eleven French people.
Therefore, the Tosa retainers fired a gun at once instead of arresting them, and killed, wounded or drowned eleven French people.

sen.j: （土佐藩側では）フランス人が迷惑不遜行為に及んだとされる。
sen.e: According to the account of the Tosa Domain, the French sailors caused nuisances and behaved irreverently.
According to the account of the Tosa Domain, the French sailors caused nuisances and behaved irreverently.
According to the account of the Tosa Domain, the French sailors caused nuisances and behaved irreverently.

sen.j: 遺体は、日本側官憲により16日に引き渡しを終えた。
sen.e: The bodies of the French sailors were returned by the Japanese police on 16th.
The bodies of the French sailors were returned by the Japanese police on March 9.
sen.cmt: 原文｢16日」は旧暦と思われましたので、新暦に直しました。
sen.e: The bodies of the French sailors were returned by the Japanese police on March 9.

sen.j: フランス公使レオン・ロッシュは2月19日、在阪各国公使と話し合い、下手人斬刑・陳謝・賠償などの5箇条からなる抗議書を日本側に提示した。
sen.e: A minister to France, Leon Roches, had a meeting with Osaka-based other foreign ministers and provided a protest note to the Japanese government, which consisted of five articles requesting the beheading of the murderers, government apology and compensations.

On March 12, A minister to France, Leon Roches, had a meeting with Osaka-based other foreign ministers and provided a protest note to the Japanese government, which consisted of five articles requesting the beheading of the murderers, government apology, compensations, and so forth.
sen.cmt: ｢2月19日」の記載がありません。旧暦と思われましたので新暦に直し、冒頭に挿入しました。「五箇条」ですが列挙されているのは3項目なので、and so forthを最後に入れました。
sen.e: On March 12, A minister to France, Leon Roches, had a meeting with Osaka-based other foreign ministers and provided a protest note to the Japanese government, which consisted of five articles requesting the beheading of the murderers, government apology, compensations, and so forth.

sen.j: 当時、各国公使と軍艦は和泉国・摂津国の間にあったから、明治政府は憂慮し、イギリス公使ハリー・パークスに調停を求めたが失敗、22日、明治政府はやむなく賠償金15万ドルの支払いと暴行者の処刑などすべての主張を飲んだ。
sen.e: At that time, as foreign ministers and warships resided or anchored between Izumi Province and Settsu Province, the deeply concerned Meiji government asked the England minister, Harry Smith Parkes, to mediate the matter, but the attempt failed and the Meiji government reluctantly accepted all the conditions including compensation of 150 thousand dollars and the beheading of the Japanese offenders.

At that time, as foreign ministers and warships resided or anchored between Izumi Province and Settsu Province, the deeply concerned Meiji government asked the England minister, Harry Smith Parkes, to mediate the matter, but the attempt failed and on March 15, the Meiji government reluctantly accepted all the conditions including compensation of 150 thousand dollars and the beheading of the Japanese offenders.
sen.cmt: Isn't "in" necessary between "anchored" and "between"?｢22日」の記載がありません。旧暦と思われましたので新暦に直し、the Meiji Governmentの前に挿入しました。
sen.e: At that time, as foreign ministers and warships resided or anchored in between Izumi Province and Settsu Province, the deeply concerned Meiji government asked the England minister, Harry Smith Parkes, to mediate the matter, but the attempt failed and on March 15, the Meiji government reluctantly accepted all the conditions including compensation of 150 thousand dollars and the beheading of the Japanese offenders.

sen.j: これは、結局、当時の国力の差は歴然としており、この状況下、この（日本側としては）無念極まりない要求も受け入れざる得なかったものとされるが、捕縛ではなく発砲による殺傷を目的とした野蛮な対応に外国は震撼せしめた。
sen.e: This incident ended up in the matter of the involved countries' power and footing, and with the outstanding power of France, Japan had no choice but to accept the unconditional requests, but at the same time, it was true that Japan's primitive action using a gun instead of a rope frightened off foreign countries.

This incident ended up in the matter of the involved countries' power and footing at that time, and with the outstanding power of France, Japan had no choice but to accept the unconditional requests, but at the same time, it was true that Japan's primitive action using a gun instead of a rope frightened off foreign countries.
sen.cmt: 「当時の」に相当するat that timeをfootingの後に挿入しました。
sen.e: This incident ended up in the matter of the involved countries' power and footing at that time, and with the outstanding power of France, Japan had no choice but to accept the unconditional requests, but at the same time, it was true that Japan's primitive action using a gun instead of a rope frightened off foreign countries.

sen.j: フランス公使は20名の切腹を要求し、事件に関わった29名の者が現在の大阪府大阪市西区 (大阪市)にある土佐稲荷神社で籤を引いて切腹する者を決めた。
sen.e: The French foreign minister requested seppuku of twenty Japanese retainers, for which 29 people involved in the case used a lot of Inari-jinja Shrine of Tosa, (present-day, Nishi Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture) to decide who would commit seppuku.

For the request from the French foreign minister asking seppuku of twenty Japanese retainers, people involved in the case drew a lot in Inari-jinja Shrine of Tosa, (present-day, Nishi Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture) to decide who would commit seppuku.
sen.cmt: for whichの先行詞が（おそらく前の文全体を意図すると思われましたが）、retainerと解釈されかねませんでしたので、前半の分をFor the request･･･にしました。「籤を引く」は辞書に「draw a lot」とありましたので、そちらを用いました。Inari-jinjaの前のof→inにしました。
sen.e: For the request from the French foreign minister asking seppuku of twenty Japanese retainers, people involved in the case drew a lot in Inari-jinja Shrine of Tosa, (present-day, Nishi Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture) to decide who would commit seppuku.

sen.j: 2月23日 (旧暦)（3月16日）、大阪裁判所の宣告により堺の妙国寺で土佐藩士20人の刑の執行が行われた。
sen.e: On March 16, the twenty retainers of the Tosa Domain were executed in the seppuku style at Myokoku-ji Temple of Sakai City in accordance with the sentence announced by the Osaka Court.
On March 16, the twenty retainers of the Tosa Domain were executed in the seppuku style at Myokoku-ji Temple of Sakai City in accordance with the sentence announced by the Osaka Court.

sen.j: 切腹の場で藩士達は自らの腸を掴み出し、居並ぶフランス水兵に次々と投げつけるという行為を行った。
sen.e: At the moment of seppuku, the retainers grabbed their own intestine and threw it to the French sailors who watched them being executed.
At the moment of seppuku, the retainers grabbed their own intestine out and threw it to the French sailors who watched them being executed.

sen.j: その凄惨さに、立ち会っていたフランス軍艦長プティ・トゥアール（Petit Thouars）は、（フランス人の被害者数と同じ）11人が切腹したところで外国局判事五代才助に中止を要請し、結果として9人が助命された。
sen.e: Petit Thouars, chief of French warship, saw the dreadful sight and requested Saisuke GODAI, a judge of foreign affairs, to stop the execution after the eleventh Tosa retainers was executed (the same figures as French casualties), sparing nine retainers lined up for execution.

Petit Thouars, the chief of French warship, saw this dreadful sight and requested Saisuke GODAI, a judge of foreign affairs, to stop the execution after the eleventh Tosa retainers was executed (the same figures as French casualties), resulting in saving nine retainers' lives.
sen.cmt: chiefの前にtheを入れました。Theをthisにしました。sparing nine retainers lined up for execution→ resulting in saving nine retainers' livesにしました。
sen.e: Petit Thouars, the chief of French warship, saw this dreadful sight and requested Saisuke GODAI, a judge of foreign affairs, to stop the execution after the eleventh Tosa retainers was executed (the same figures as French casualties), resulting in saving nine retainers' lives.

sen.j: 一説に、暮色四辺にたちこめ、ついに日暮れるに至り、軍艦長は帰途における襲撃を恐れたからであるという。
sen.e: According to one theory, as sun was setting in, the chief was afraid of the raid by Japanese people on his way back.

sen.j: 本人の日誌によれば、侍への同情も感じながら、この形での処刑はフランス側が望むように戒めになるところか、逆に侍が英雄視されると理解し、中断させたそうである。
sen.e: In his own diary, the chief wrote the reason of stopping the execution that it was true that he felt pity for the retainers, but he also thought the execution in that manner would not serve as a warning against future killing but it would merely hero-worship the retainers.

In his own diary, the chief wrote that while he felt pity for the retainers, he also thought the execution in that manner would not serve as a warning against future killing but it would merely hero-worship the retainers and that was why he stopped the execution.
sen.cmt: 「the reason of stopping the execution that it was true」→「and that was why he stopped the execution」にして最後に入れました。最初のbutをwhileにしてthatの直後に入れました。

sen.j: 2月24日、外国事務局総督山階宮晃親王は、大阪鎮台外国事務兼務伊達宗城を伴ってフランス艦に行き、謝意を表し、償金15万ドルを交付した。
sen.e: On February 24, Imperial Prince Yamashinanomiya Akira, governor-general of foreign affairs, visited the French warship with Munenari DATE, an official of Osaka garrison and foreign affairs, to apologize for the incident and paid the compensation of 150 thousand dollars.

On March 17, Imperial Prince Yamashinanomiya Akira, governor-general of foreign affairs, together with Munenari DATE, an official of Osaka garrison and foreign affairs, visited the French warship to apologize for the incident and paid the compensation of 150 thousand dollars.
sen.cmt: visited the French warshipの前にtogether with Munenariを移動しました。2月24日は旧暦と思われましたので新暦に直しました。

sen.j: 処刑を免れた橋詰愛平ら9人は、土佐の渡川（四万十川）以西の入田へ配流され庄屋宇賀佑之進預けとなり、その後明治新政府の恩赦により帰郷した。
sen.e: The nine retainers including Aihei HASHIZUME who were spared their lives were sent to Irita, the west of Watari-gawa River (Shimanto-gawa River) of Tosa, and put under the charge of a village headman, Yunoshin UGA, and later returned to Tosa with a pardon from the new Meiji government.

sen.j: 自刃した土佐藩士は妙国寺内にあつく葬られ、遭難したフランス人の碑も神戸市立外国人墓地に建てられた。
sen.e: The executed Tosa retainers were buried in a revered manner on the precinct of Myokoku-ji Temple and a monument for the French sailors killed was also elected in the foreign cemetery of Kobe City.
